_description: John Skelton, ‘The Tunnyng of Elymour Rummyng’ — 623 lines in ‘skeltonics’

BLAdd22504.First Lines:
[Þ]u þinge for to knowe god almyȝtyes þe seuene
                    sacramentes þat holy chirche gifes…
BLAdd22504.Last Lines:
…mekely to suffur wheþer so euere fall is woo or
                    welþeand þat our herte be noghte ouer highe for no
                    welfare…
BLAdd22504.Note:
Transcript from early print. Written as prose. Text is incomplete,
                    ending mid-way through the sixth vertue.
